VI.ii.3.A.1.e
.
Definition:  Non-Award Days
The term
non-award days
, for the purpose of this section, refers to days for which a Veteran received no compensation or pension because, for example, VA
stopped the Veteran’s award
due to a return to active duty, or
because the Veteran expressly requested that benefits be discontinued during a training period, or
wasn’t paying the Veteran disability compensation because no compensable service-connected (SC) disabilities existed.
The term does
not
refer to periods of time during which VA withheld a Veteran’s entire award to
offset receipt of military retired pay, or
recoup separation benefits.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section A - Adjusting Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Benefits Based on a Veteran's Receipt of Drill Pay
